thread.title: Arsene Wenger says his commitment to Arsenal should never be questioned whether he stays ‘for two years or ten years’
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger says his commitment to Arsenal should never be questioned whether he stays ‘for two years or ten years’

author: dwright
title: Arsene Wenger says his commitment to Arsenal should never be questioned whether he stays ‘for two years or ten years’

organizations.name: antonio conte no joshing manchester united

text:
Comments ARSENE WENGER has gone on the attack against the critics who doubt his commitment to Arsenal. 
Wenger has been accused of causing instability at the club over his refusal to make public whether he will be staying or leaving at the end of the season. PA:Press Association 5 Arsene Wenger has come out fighting against his Arsenal critics 
But the Gunners boss has come out fighting in an interview with Sky Sports where he has given the clearest indication yet he is up for staying on at the Emirates. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Asked if the lack of clarity was causing problems at the club, Wenger said: “It would be an easy excuse. Whether I stay two years or 10 years I have exactly the same commitment and the same desire to win the next game. EPA 5 Wenger has denied his delay in announcing a decision on his future is causing instability at the club 
“I believe we are in a position where we do not have to find easy excuses. Our job is to perform. Can you perform despite that? 
“To be professional is to perform on the football pitch and not look for excuses that are not really problems off the pitch. 
“The worst you accuse me of, having done 20 years at the club, is creating instability. If I have created anything it is stability. "The situation is not sorted out and I believe it's important we focus on what is essential. 
"You know my attachment to this club and at the moment it is as it is and I do not see any escape route to have less responsibility because of that. 
"You have to be men and focus on what matters and what is our job." 
The Gunners have come in for criticism for the way they have crashed out of Europe and the top four in the Premier League after a woeful run of performances and results. PA:Press Association Arsene Wenger says his commitment to Arsenal should never be questioned EPA He also claimed his own contract situation had nothing to do with the abject display at West Brom 
But Wenger dismisses any suggestion his contract issues are to blame in any way. 
He added: "I don't believe so but we can have a difference of opinions. 
"You do not need to concede a corner because I have not signed a five-year contract. 
"You defend on a corner no matter if your manager is has a one month or 10-year contract. Getty Images 5 Arsene Wenger says his players cannot use his own contract talks as an excuse for poor form 
"We have to look at ourselves and believe in our qualities because if you look at our offensive numbers they are very positive in the league. 
"We need to defend better and that's why we've lost some big games. When I say defend better it's not just the defenders it's the team as a whole."
